provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Coconut (Regulation of
Sales) Regulations, 1958.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. In these Regulations “controlled article” means “coconuts” and
“coconut products” as defined in section 2 of the Act.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Save as is hereinafter provided no person shall impose or attempt
to impose any condition in connection with the sale or proposed sale
of any controlled article whereby the purchaser or intending purchaser
of any such controlled article is required to purchase or agree to
purchase either at the time of the proposed sale or at any future time
any article or articles other than the articles actually requested by him:
  Provided, however, that the provisions of this regulation shall not
apply to sales made by the Trustee in Bankruptcy, the Administrator-
General, the Commissioner of Customs and Excise, the Commissioner of
Inland Revenue, a Bailiff of a Court or any person acting under the
written authority of the Minister.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. No person having in his possession for the purpose of sale any
controlled article shall refuse to sell such quantity of such article as
may be requested by a person offering to pay cash therefor at the
maximum selling price:
  Provided, however, that where the quantity of any controlled article
requested by a prospective purchaser is excessive, having regard to the
vendor’s stock of such article at the time of the request and to the
number of his customers to be supplied therewith, the vendor may
refuse to supply the quantity of such article required by the purchaser
or any portion thereof:

20      THE COCONUT (REGULATION OF SALES) REGULATIONS, 1958
       And provided further that in either such event he submit the matter
     in writing to the Minister within twenty-four hours of such refusal 01
     partial refusal, as the case may be.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. Where any controlled article is found upon the business premises
     of any person who ordinarily trades in such article or in articles of a
     similar nature. such controlled article shall be deemed to be in the
     possession of such person for the purpose of sale until the contrary is
     proved.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6. Every person who contravenes or fails or omits to comply with
     any of these Regulations shall, on summary conviction thereof before
     a Resident Magistrate, be liable to a penalty not exceeding one hundred
     dollars.
